STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 28, 2023
Melissa VanLuven
SAULT TRIBE BINOGII - PLACEMENT
2218 SHUNK RD,
SAULT S MARIE, MI, 49783-9467
Re: License #: CN170201399
Dear Ms. VanLuven:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
June 2, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the
home.
Eight files and twenty three services plans were reviewed. One of twenty three was
completed late. The ISP report was due on August 20, 2022, and was completed on
September 8, 2022.
VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the
following information before employment may occur:
(e) A record of any convictions other than minor
traffic violations from either of the following:
(i) The Michigan state police or the equivalent
state or Canadian provincial law enforcement agency
where the person usually resides.
Ten employee files were reviewed. One of ten did not document that a criminal
background check had been completed prior to employment.
2

CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90 calendar days
thereafter.
Eight files and twenty three services plans were reviewed. One of twenty three was
completed late. The USP was due December 26, 2022 and was completed
December 27, 2022.
CPA Rule 400.12708 Child evaluation
(1) A social service worker shall complete a written
assessment of each child available for adoption
within 60 days of the child being referred for
adoption. The assessment shall include all
information available in the foster care file from the
date the child entered care and shall meet all
requirements of section 27 of 1939 PA 288, MCL
710.27.
Three child evaluations were reviewed. Two of three evaluations documented that
the child assessment was completed after the 60-day time period required by the
rule. In one file the child was referred for adoption on March 22, 2022, and the
evaluation was completed on September 14, 2022. A second file documented that
the child was referred for adoption on August 11, 2022, and the adoption evaluation
was completed on May 9, 2023.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who
are a member of a participating household. • Youth
3

ages 14 and older. • Foster parents, relative
caregivers, and unrelated court ordered caregivers.
Eight files and twenty-three treatment plans were reviewed. One of twenty-three
treatment plans documented a late caregiver signature. The treatment plan was
completed on August 17, 2022, and was signed by the caregiver on September 28,
2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Technical assistance was not offered at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period. There were no repeat violations established during the current
Interim Inspection indicating that the agency CAP submitted from the 2022
Renewal Inspection was successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was thorough and addressed
corrective action compliance from the 2022 renewal inspection. The assessment
noted that continued barriers include staff turnover and the time required to train
new staff. The assessment also noted that the new contract compliance system
and the frequent changes in the child welfare system pose ongoing challenges for
the agency.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted an annual budget as well as an annual certified public
accountant audit for review.
4

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their supervisors and that their
supervisors are very knowledgeable. Staff also reported feeling that they are part
of a supportive team and everyone works together.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is spacious, modern, well organized and equipped with technical
equipment needed to perform the functions required of the agency.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
SAFETY ALERT 1
The CPA Analyst generated a safety alert on April 5, 2023, regarding a foster home
which did not have a crib but was using a bassinet for an infant. A complaint was
filed on April 7, 2023, and the agency was notified. The agency notified the foster
parent, who had a crib, that it needed to be installed within 24 hours. The agency
visited the home on April 10, 2023, to confirm the crib was installed and being used.
Photos were taken and uploaded.
SAFETY ALERT 2
The home was not visited by the CPA Analyst as it is a Tribal licensed home.
Two agency workers visited the home on February 14, 2023, and did not find any
safety concerns. Photos were taken of installed smoke and carbon monoxide
alarms. A corrective action plan was not required.
The CPA Analyst, during the entrance conference, reported that families stated they
were satisfied with services provided by the agency.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
June 28, 2023
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
